intro: Nothoscordum stenandrum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved false leek, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers. The plant produces elongated, cylindrical seed pods that contain numerous small, black seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in coastal or disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
